subject_description: Physics is the study of matter, energy, and their interactions. This subject covers fundamental concepts from mechanics to quantum physics.
chapter_description: Study of motion and forces in the physical world
chapter_syllabus: Newton's laws, kinematics, dynamics, energy conservation
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand Newton's laws of motion,Apply conservation of energy principles,Solve problems involving forces and motion
topic_description: Study of motion without considering forces
topic_content: Kinematics deals with the description of motion. Key concepts include displacement, velocity, and acceleration. The fundamental equations are: v = v‚ÇÄ + at and s = v‚ÇÄt + ¬Ωat¬≤
topic_learning_objectives: Define displacement, velocity, and acceleration,Apply kinematic equations to solve problems,Interpret position-time and velocity-time graphs
topic_key_concepts: Displacement, Velocity, Acceleration, Time, Initial velocity, Final velocity
topic_formulas: v = v‚ÇÄ + at, s = v‚ÇÄt + ¬Ωat¬≤, v¬≤ = v‚ÇÄ¬≤ + 2as

subject_description: Physics is the study of matter, energy, and their interactions. This subject covers fundamental concepts from mechanics to quantum physics.
chapter_description: Study of motion and forces in the physical world
chapter_syllabus: Newton's laws, kinematics, dynamics, energy conservation
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand Newton's laws of motion,Apply conservation of energy principles,Solve problems involving forces and motion
topic_description: Study of forces and their effects on motion
topic_content: Dynamics focuses on the causes of motion. Newton's laws form the foundation: F = ma, action-reaction pairs, and gravitational forces.
topic_learning_objectives: Apply Newton's laws to various situations,Calculate forces in different scenarios,Understand action-reaction pairs
topic_key_concepts: Force, Mass, Acceleration, Newton's laws, Gravity, Friction
topic_formulas: F = ma, F = G(m‚ÇÅm‚ÇÇ)/r¬≤, f = ŒºN

subject_description: Chemistry explores the composition, structure, and properties of matter. This subject covers atomic theory, chemical bonding, and reactions.
chapter_description: Study of atoms and their electronic structure
chapter_syllabus: Atomic models, electron configuration, quantum numbers
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand atomic structure and electron arrangement,Apply quantum mechanical principles,Write electron configurations
topic_content: Electronic configuration follows the Aufbau principle, Pauli exclusion principle, and Hund's rule. Electrons fill orbitals in order of increasing energy.
topic_learning_objectives: Write electron configurations for elements,Understand orbital filling rules,Apply Hund's rule
topic_key_concepts: Orbitals, Energy levels, Aufbau principle, Pauli exclusion, Hund's rule

subject_description: Chemistry explores the composition, structure, and properties of matter. This subject covers atomic theory, chemical bonding, and reactions.
chapter_description: Study of how atoms combine to form molecules
chapter_syllabus: Ionic bonding, covalent bonding, molecular geometry
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand different types of chemical bonds,Apply VSEPR theory,Draw Lewis structures
topic_content: Covalent bonding involves the sharing of electron pairs between atoms. The octet rule guides bond formation, and molecular geometry follows VSEPR theory.
topic_learning_objectives: Draw Lewis structures,Apply VSEPR theory,Predict molecular shapes
topic_key_concepts: Electron sharing, Octet rule, Lewis structures, VSEPR, Molecular geometry
topic_formulas: Octet rule, VSEPR theory, Bond order = (bonding - antibonding)/2

subject_description: Calculus is the mathematical study of continuous change. This subject covers differentiation, integration, and their applications.
chapter_description: Study of rates of change and slopes of curves
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand the concept of limits,Calculate derivatives using various rules,Apply derivatives to optimization problems
chapter_prerequisites: Strong foundation in algebra and trigonometry
topic_content: Limits describe the behavior of functions as they approach specific values. Continuity ensures smooth transitions without breaks or jumps.
topic_learning_objectives: Evaluate limits algebraically and graphically,Understand continuity conditions,Apply limit laws
topic_key_concepts: Limits, Continuity, One-sided limits, Infinite limits, Limit laws
topic_formulas: lim(x‚Üía) f(x) = L, lim(x‚Üía) [f(x) + g(x)] = lim(x‚Üía) f(x) + lim(x‚Üía) g(x)

subject_description: Calculus is the mathematical study of continuous change. This subject covers differentiation, integration, and their applications.
chapter_description: Study of rates of change and slopes of curves
chapter_learning_objectives: Understand the concept of limits,Calculate derivatives using various rules,Apply derivatives to optimization problems
chapter_prerequisites: Strong foundation in algebra and trigonometry
topic_description: Rules for finding derivatives of functions
topic_content: Derivative rules provide systematic methods for finding derivatives. The power rule, product rule, quotient rule, and chain rule are fundamental tools.
topic_learning_objectives: Apply power rule to polynomial functions,Use product and quotient rules,Implement chain rule for composite functions
topic_key_concepts: Power rule, Product rule, Quotient rule, Chain rule, Implicit differentiation
